note.p: Education: BA (1873, 7th Wrangler), MA (1876), St John's College Cambridge

Career: Fellow of St John's College, Cambridge; Professor of Physics and Mathematics, Firth College, Sheffield (1883-1892); Principal of Firth College, Sheffield (1892-1897); Professor of Physics, University of Sheffield (1892-1917); Principal of University College, Sheffield (1897-1905); guided the development of Firth College into a University College; first Vice Chancellor, University of Sheffield (1905)
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1932-1935 vol l pp 393-399, plate, by S R Milner
